Subjective: Back pain radiating to right leg, thigh, and foot for 1.5 weeks. Painful, constant, and worsening. Meds: Paracetamol and ibuprofen, no relief. Negatives: No trauma, no shortness of breath, no chest pain. Social: Works in supermarket, temporarily stopped working due to pain. ICE (Concern): Worried about cause and sleep disturbance.
Objective: BP: Not recorded. Neuro: Strength normal, but painful. Musculoskeletal: Pain on active elevation of right leg, decreased sensation on right lower leg. Reflexes: Normal.
Assessment: Herniated intervertebral disc with nerve compression (susp. HNP). Ruled out: No signs of cauda equina.
Plan: 1. Pregabalin for pain relief (build up dose slowly). 2. Physiotherapy to improve back flexibility and reduce nerve compression. 3. Telephone follow-up in 1 week to discuss pain relief progress. Safety net: Contact if symptoms worsen, loss of sensation in 'riding breeches area', or leg weakness.
